channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Netanyahu’s Plan to Expand Israel’s Fight in Gaza Is Met With Skepticism
item.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said that a new plan calls for a “forceful entry” into the territory and would involve Palestinians relocating to th...

item.title: Millions of student loan borrowers head to collections as delinquency rates soar over 20%
item.description: Some will have wages and benefits garnished, putting even more strain on an already unstable economy.

item.title: UnitedHealth’s Move to End Cyberattack Loan Lifeline Upsets Medical Providers
item.description: The company lent roughly $9 billion to practices affected by a vast cyberattack on its payment systems last year. Medical practices are now suing the ...

item.title: Powell won’t cut interest rates on Wednesday, Wharton’s Jeremy Siegel says. He suspects attacks on the Fed chair will escalate
item.description: “Powell is not going to do anything,” Siegel said in an interview. “Trump, I think, is going to step up the escalation,” he said later.

item.title: Bill Gates says lack of climate cooperation is unlikely to last
item.description: Unwinding global collaborations to address climate change “works against us,” Gates said.

item.title: Scott Bessent Urges Investors to Bet on Trump’s Economic Plan
item.description: The Treasury secretary urged executives and entrepreneurs to look beyond the Trump administration’s trade agenda.

item.title: U.N. Court Drops Sudan’s Genocide Case Against U.A.E.
item.description: The International Court of Justice said it lacked jurisdiction after Sudan accused the United Arab Emirates of fueling genocide in the African country...

item.title: Inside the Most Politically Charged Met Gala in Years
item.description: The party and its related exhibition, about Black male style, land in a moment when anything to do with race and diversity is under added scrutiny.

item.title: 94-year-old Warren Buffett isn’t retiring from Berkshire Hathaway and its $348 billion cash pile just yet
item.description: The billionaire will remain chairman of the board at Berkshire Hathaway when vice chairman Greg Abel takes over.

item.title: Warren Buffett credits Apple CEO Tim Cook with making ‘a lot more money than I’ve ever made’ for Berkshire Hathaway
item.description: Apple was a rare tech investment for Buffett, who always preferred to think of the iPhone-maker as a consumer goods company.

item.title: Rwanda in Talks With Trump Administration to Take in Migrants Deported From U.S.
item.description: Discussions with the Central African country come as the Trump administration looks for more countries willing to accept deportees as part of a sweepi...

item.title: Survivors Urge Cardinals to Discuss Sex Abuse Crisis in Choosing Next Pope
item.description: Pope Francis is credited with addressing the issue more strongly than his predecessors did, but clerical abuse remains a ruinous issue for the Roman C...

item.title: Netanyahu’s Plan to Expand Israel’s Fight in Gaza Is Met With Skepticism
item.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said that a new plan calls for a “forceful entry” into the territory and would involve Palestinians relocating to th...

item.title: U.N. Court Drops Sudan’s Genocide Case Against U.A.E.
item.description: The International Court of Justice said it lacked jurisdiction after Sudan accused the United Arab Emirates of fueling genocide in the African country...

item.title: Cable Theft in Spain Disrupts Train Travel for Thousands, Officials Say
item.description: Oscar Puente, the transport minister, said “a serious act of sabotage” had brought some trains to a halt. Service was resuming on Monday.
